column4: was the QA team totally asleep for Lucid?  I mean, a show-stopping boot bug?  that's pretty serious
not seen a boot bug here
did you md5 test the iso you downloaded?
if you dont you have zero chance of knowing what you downloaded is complete or consistant do you?
this is true.  but the same issue has been reported by multiple in the beta, so i doubt that's the problem
well isolate yours by knowing the iso is good, if it fails md5 you know your data is the blame
ALWAYS ALWAYS MD% test the ISO and ALWAYS ALWAYS run the CD checker
I would run the CD checker, except the CD won't load...won't load anything at all to let me do that.  I will check md5 now though
you should have tested it before burning, garbage data will make garbae CDs
the md5 is good.  it downloaded fine.  it's a bug
and/or disable pointless hardware in bios (like sound/lan)
yeah there was a mention of a fix, but how do u access the boot menu on the live to change the command line?
